definition: to seize/to clutch/to grab firmly and pull
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to grab sb by the queue (i.e. hair)/to seize on weak points/to exploit the opponent's shortcomings
folk remedy involving repeatedly pinching the neck, throat, back etc to increase blood flow to the area and relieve inflammation
to seize and send (to court, to face punishment)
to seize and subject to public criticism (form of persecution during the Cultural Revolution)

sentences.english: One of the biggest disrupters of sleep is the pulling and tugging of sheets and blankets.
sentences.chinese: 俩人一块儿睡的时候，最烦的就是拉被单和揪毯子了。

sentences.english: Withnail: I've some extremely distressing news.
sentences.chinese: 我有一些真揪的很悲伤的消卵息。

sentences.english: The police yanked the offenders off to the police station.

sentences.chinese: 这段日子过得并不好，心里总揪紧着种种焦虑。

sentences.english: Either, man cannot be off the ground with his hair pulled up by his own hand.

sentences.english: My stomach was turning over and over as I waited for my turn on the stage.

sentences.english: She sighed and then pinched a bit of skin on my arm and twisted it.
sentences.chinese: 她叹了口气，然后从我胳膊上揪起一小块肉拧了一下。

definition: to pick (flowers)/to pinch/to nip/to pinch off/to clutch/(slang) to fight
to pinch (with one's fingers)/to knead/to make up
to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
to attempt all tasks at once/to manage every detail regardless of its importance
to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
to stab/to poke/to prod/to nudge/to disclose
to beat with the fist/to hammer/to cudgel
